definition:
be commanded or requested to                                      
             
             you must stop

be urged to : ought by all means to                                      
             
             you must read that book

be compelled by physical necessity to                                      
             
             one must eat to live

be obliged to : be compelled by social considerations to                                      
             
             I must say you're looking well

be required by law, custom, or moral conscience (see conscience sense 1) to                                      
             
             we must obey the rules

be determined to                                      
             
             if you must go at least wait for me

be unreasonably or perversely compelled to                                      
             
             why must you argue

be logically inferred (see infer sense 1) or supposed to                                      
             
             it must be time

be compelled by fate or by natural law to                                      
             
             what must be will be

was or were presumably certain to : was or were bound to                                      
             
             if he did it she must have known

may, shall                                      
                
                  —used chiefly in questions

to be obliged to go                                      
             
             I must to Coventry
an imperative need or duty : requirement

an indispensable item : essential                                      
             
             exercise is a must
the expressed juice of fruit and especially grapes before and during fermentation
musk
mold entry 3, mustiness
—used to say that something is required by a rule or law
—used to say that someone should do something
—used to say that something is very likely

to be commanded, requested, or urged to                                      
             
             You must stop the noise at once.

to be required to                                      
             
             A person must eat to live.

to be very likely to                                      
             
             It must be time.

something that is or seems to be required or necessary                                      
             
             Sturdy shoes are a must for this hike.
in: you must stop
you must read that book
one must eat to live
we must hurry to catch the bus
I must say you're looking well
we must obey the rules
if you must go at least wait for me
why must you argue
it must be time
what must be will be
if he did it she must have known
I must to Coventry
exercise is a must
we must be quiet during the performance
You must stop the noise at once.
A person must eat to live.
It must be time.
I must have lost it.
Sturdy shoes are a must for this hike.

definition: used for saying that you think something is probably true because nothing else seems possible
used for saying that it is necessary or important to do something
used for ordering someone to do or not do something
used for saying that it is your duty to do something
used for suggesting to someone that they should do something because it would be enjoyable, interesting etc
used for emphasizing that you intend to do something
used to say that something is necessary even though it is undesirable, unpleasant, or unfavourable
in: You must be tired after your long journey.
There must be some mistake – no one called Shaw lives here.
They must have got lost or they’d be here by now.
I must have fallen asleep.
Tomato plants must be watered regularly.
People must realize that there are limits to what we can do.
I’ve told you the truth. Must I keep repeating it?
We mustn’t be late.
You must answer all the questions.
Shayler was warned that he must not publish the allegations.
We must defend the freedom that our parents fought for.
You must come and visit us again some time.
You must see the Monet exhibition – it’s really wonderful.
I must introduce you to my brother.
if you (really) must
must you?
what/why must...?

definition: used to show that it is necessary or very important that something happens in the present or future:
If you say that you must do something, you mean that you strongly intend to do something in the future:
used for emphasis:
If you tell someone else that they must do something pleasant, you are emphasizing that you think it is a good idea to do that:
used to show that something is very likely, probable, or certain to be true:
something that is necessary:
something that is so good, you must do it, have it, or see it:
used to show that it is necessary or important that something happen in the present or future:
If you say that you must do something, you can mean that you have a firm intention to do something in the future:
Must is sometimes used for emphasis:
used to show that something is likely, probable, or certain to be true:
in: Meat must be cooked thoroughly.
I must get some sleep.
You mustn't show this letter to anyone else.
Luggage must not be left unattended (= it is against the rules).
Must you leave so soon?
"Must I sign this?" "Yes, you must."
I must phone my sister.
We must get someone to fix that wheel.
I mustn't bite my nails.
I must say, you look absolutely great.
I must admit, I wasn't looking forward to it.
You must come and stay with us one weekend.
We must meet for lunch soon.
Harry's been driving all day - he must be tired.
There's no food left - we must have eaten it all.
When you got lost in the forest you must have been very frightened.
"You must know Frank." "No, I don't."
If you live in the country a car is a must.
The cashmere scarf is this season's must-have.
It's a moderately entertaining film but it's certainly not a must-see.
Seeing what others have and she lacks, she believes that she must have more.
We must not surprise them (= it is wrong, dangerous, or forbidden).
I must call my sister later.
I must admit I enjoy these movies.
Death must be better than this.
"It must have been fun." "No, it wasn’t."
If you live in the suburbs a car is a must.
You mustn't confuse the problem with the way in which the problem will be resolved.
The top of the cooker mustn't look dirty, whatever happens.
I mustn't prejudice my relationship with my minister beyond refusing to accept a ban on internal discussions within the department.
You mustn't, not with a complaint like he's got (wife, no diagnosis ; husband with dementia).
We mustn't endorse technology for its own sake, nor simply for its economic potential, but ask what its ends are.
In fact, one mustn't do it, not like that; one couldn't go on.
You mustn't allow enough time for the mind to think of an alternative.
Just because there are dark fogs which our sun hasn't yet penetrated we mustn't let the sun lose its glare.
What you mustn't do is waver, say in the same breath that he both can and can't, and then claim that this contradiction proves that time travel is impossible.
You mustn't reinforce the role with 'gimmicks'.
One mustn't think it's a miracle.
The stretching of these variables is restricted, however, by the condition that both terms in the equation of continuitymust remain of the same order of magnitude.
There must be an increased availability and access to drug treatment that is sensitive to pregnant and post-partum women in an urban society.
Many of our participants clearly felt that they ' mustn't complain ', which may be an adaptive psychological strategy for coping with the vicissitudes of advancing age.
If they have not got any amusements up in their backwoods, we mustn't have none.

translated_as@fr: Elle doit l’avoir laissé à l”école.
Tu dois avoir soif après avoir tant couru.
Tu dois payer / il faut que tu payes cet argent pour demain.

definition: A very bad odor, usually when a person doesn't shower and/or doesn't put d-eo and/or breath smells like shit

Marginalized Orientations, Gender identities, And Intersex. it’s meant to be an all inclusive umbrella term for asexuals, homosexuals, multisexuals, trans people, and intersex people. Alternative to LGBTQIAP+
Alternative to MOGII, easier to pronounce.

Confirmation, approval or agreement of an action that is shared by one or more persons.Based on outcome of Jicha Vs Alward, a 2010 juror ruling known as the JichaPants Verdict, ruled 11-1 that Must is in fact equal to or greater than Must.The only exception is when Must, which normally equals Must, can be overruled by Must - (Must/Must + Must * Must) * Must/Must * Must squared = Must. Then it just equals Must.Must can also achieve significant interest when equaling Must as seen here: MUST = P(1+MUST)^MUSTAdditionally, the amount of MUST found in the surface area of a sphere can be found by using MUST = 4Pi(MUST*MUST)
a severe odor that tends to follow certain wherever they go. Often caused lack of bathing, brushing teeth or changing clothes.
Something that is just purely disgusting or gross, no just necessarily a smell
An annual period of heightened aggressiveness and sexual activity in male elephants, during which violent frenzies occur.
indian word for something that is awesome.
